title: CV
text:
Education

2020 - 2022: Master’s in Botany, Bishop Heber College, Bharathidasan University, Tamil Nadu, India
2017 - 2020 - Bachelor’s in Plant Biology and Plant Biotechnology, Madras Christian College, University of Madras, Tamil Nadu, India.

title: CV
text:
Work Experience

2022: Master’s Academic Project; Goa University

Conducted Phenological Studies of Trees in Socorro Plateau, Goa.  The project involved studying the phenological patterns of various trees in Socorro plateau, by plotting their flowering, fruiting and leafing growth patterns and also understanding the various inter-connections which exist in between the different flora of the region.

2022: Internship; project run by Institute of Botany, Czech Academy of Sciences

Assisted in the sampling of plant material from high elevations of Western Himalayas for belowground and aboveground trait measurements, soil sampling and processing of collected samples. The research work was conducted as part of a Horizon 2020 project entitled “Functional differentiation in response to environmental variability in two contrasting shrub line species of high-altitude Himalaya.”

title: CV
text:
Conferences

52nd Annual conference of the Ecological Society of Germany, Austria and Switzerland (GfÖ) hosted by the German Centre for Integrative Biodiversity Research (iDiv) Halle-Jena-Leipzig; Presented a poster entitled “Effects of Changes in Soil Nutrient and Water Availability on Floral Economic Spectrum” under session “Traits and Stability” on 12th & 13th September, 2023.
International Conference on Climate Change Adaptation for Sustainable Biodiversity and Food Security organized by the Department of Zoology and Research Centre, Scott Christian College (Autonomous), Nagercoil, Tamil Nadu, India; Presented a paper entitled “Investigation into the Phenological Patterns of Trees in Socorro Plateau, Goa” on 23rd & 24th June, 2022 and was awarded Best Oral Presentation Award under the subtheme “Biodiversity”.
National Seminar on Innovative Research Approaches in Biological Sciences organized by PG and Research Department of Botany, Jamal Mohamed College, Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India and presented a paper entitled “Phenological Studies of Trees in Socorro Plateau, Goa” on 25th & 26th May, 2022.
International Conference on Climate Adaptation and Resilience organized by Department of Environmental Sciences, Bishop Heber College, Tiruchirappalli, Tamil Nadu, India and presented a paper entitled “Aphid – Ant Interactions in Different Plant Species” on 22nd & 23rd April, 2022.

title: CV
text:
Other Participation

Attended Workshop on quantitative ecology titled, “School of Quantitative Ecology 2024 (SSoQE2024)” at the ecological outstation of the University of Bayreuth in Wallenfels, Germany from 23.09.2024 to 29.09.2024.
Worked as volunteer and attended the 53nd annual conference of the Ecological Society of Germany, Austria and Switzerland (GfÖ) hosted by the Technical University of Munich’s Weihenstephan campus in Freising from 9-13 September, 2024.
Worked as volunteer in the 52nd annual conference of the Ecological Society of Germany, Austria and Switzerland (GfÖ) hosted by the German Centre for Integrative Biodiversity Research (iDiv) Halle-Jena-Leipzig from 11-16 September, 2023.
Online Workshop on ‘Plant Inventory Methods – I’ organized by Manipal Centre for Natural Sciences, Manipal, Karnataka, India on 14th and 15th February, 2021.
Online Training Program under the theme of ‘Botany & Plant Biotechnology’ organized by CSIR – Indian Institute of Integrative Medicine, Jammu, India. This training program was conducted under the scheme “CSIR-Integrated Skill Initiative Program” from August, 2021 to October, 2021.
Online Summer Training Program in Biological Sciences organized by Academy of Sciences, Chennai in association with Department of Zoology, University of Madras, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India from July, 2021 to August, 2021.
Online Workshop on Restoration Ecology and People’s Participation organized by Department of Zoology, Madras Christian College, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India on 18th and 19th August, 2021.
Hands on Training in Seaweed Cultivation and Processing Technology organized by CSIR-CSMCRI, Bhavnagar at CSMCRI – Marine Algal Research Station, Mandapam Camp, Tamil Nadu, India. This training program was conducted under the scheme “CSIR-Integrated Skill Initiative Program” from 17th to 19th March, 2021.

title: Murugash Manavalan
text:
Hi, Im Murugash Manavalan and Im a PhD Scholar in Charles University, CZ.
My research focus revolves around the Floral Economic Spectrum (FES) and its significance in relation to the Whole Plant Economic Spectrum. In accordance with that, I am studying the interspecific variation of various plant functional traits of species belonging to the Grasslands of Czechia, giving particular emphasis to floral traits. In addition, I will also be studying how the interacting effects of different environmental factors such as nutrient availability and water scarcity alter floral traits which will provide key insights into the various adaptation strategies undertaken by plants in times of stress.

title: Nature Photography by Murugash
text:

title: Floral Economics under Global Change
text:
In this study, we tried to examine the impacts of key global change factors-elevated temperature, increased atmospheric CO2, and drought - on the floral economic traits of two grassland species. We further tried to invesitgate how these responses compare and contrast with those of leaf economic traits.
This entire study was conducted within the framework of the ClimGrass Experiment, a long-term climate manipulation experiment located in the Agricultural Research and Education Centre, Austria who is a also a key collaborator in this project.
The research article pertaining to this project is currently under review. You can access the preprint here.

objectID: projects/Effect of Drought and Soil Fertility on Flowers.html
href: projects/Effect of Drought and Soil Fertility on Flowers.html
title: Effect of Drought and Soil Fertility on Flowers
text:
This project forms the foundation of my PhD research. We aim to understand how floral traits respond to varying levels of nutrient and water availability—and their interaction—to gain deeper insights into plant resource allocation strategies.
Our experimental system includes approximately 30 insect-pollinated species typical of Czech grasslands. Unlike our parallel project, this study expands beyond floral economic traits to also examine floral rewards and volatile compounds. Additionally, we’re investigating how reproductive traits—such as floral morphology and seed characteristics—correlate with leaf and root traits.
Interested in this research and see potential for collaboration? Please feel free to reach out to me and we can discuss the possibility of working together.
